title: Showers expected after 2.00 p.m. today
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle and Matara districts after 2.00 p.m. today (23).

title: Israeli airstrike kills Hamas political leader in southern Gaza
byline: An Israeli airstrike in southern Gaza’s Khan Younis killed Hamas political leader Salah al-Bardaweel, Hamas and Palestinian media reported in the early hours of Sunday.

title: Police receive 3 election-related complaints ahead of LG Polls
byline: The Police Headquarters has confirmed that three election-related complaints were reported to police stations across the island on March 21, ahead of the upcoming local government elections.

title: Sri Lanka can be among 4 frontier markets – CSE Chairman
byline: The Chairman of the Colombo Stock Exchange Dilshan Weerasekara claims that Sri Lanka has the potential to showcase its investment opportunities to foreign investors and be among the 04 frontier markets in the South Asian region along with Pakistan, Bangladesh, and the Maldives.

title: NPP to present Bill on confiscation of illegally acquired state property
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) is set to present a bill in Parliament aimed at reclaiming state property that has been illegally or improperly acquired under previous governments, MP Chandana Suriyarachchi says.

title: Pope Francis to be discharged from hospital today
byline: Pope Francis, who has been battling pneumonia for more than five weeks, will be discharged from hospital on Sunday but will need a further two months of rest at the Vatican, the head of his medical team said on Saturday.

title: 22 killed in 27 shooting incidents thus far in 2025
byline: Police have reported a surge in gun violence across Sri Lanka, with 27 shooting incidents recorded since January 1, 2025. These incidents have resulted in the deaths of 22 people, with several others injured.

title: Two suspects arrested with smuggled cigarettes at BIA
byline: Two individuals have been arrested at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake for smuggling foreign cigarettes.

title: Italy’s talks with Musk’s Starlink have stalled, minister says
byline: Negotiations on a potential contract between Elon Musk‘s satellite internet operator Starlink and the Italian government have stalled, reflecting broader geopolitical tensions, Italy’s defence minister said on Saturday.

title: The Searchers to end touring after 68 years
byline: The Searchers will end nearly 70 years of touring with their debut at the Glastonbury Festival.

title: Prisons Dept. responds to ex-IGP Deshabandu’s request for home-cooked meals
byline: The Department of Prisons has stated that it will review the request made by suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandhu Tennakoon, who is currently remanded in custody, to receive meals from home during his time in custody.

title: Venezuela reaches agreement with US to resume repatriation flights of migrants
byline: Venezuela has reached an agreement with the United States to resume repatriation flights of migrants, President Nicolas Maduro announced in a televised address on Saturday.

title: 85 kg of Kerala cannabis found buried at beach in Jaffna
byline: A stock of Kerala cannabis weighing around 85 kilograms has been seized in a joint operation conducted by the Military Intelligence Corps (MIC) and the Maradankerni Police in the Kaddaikadu area of Jaffna.

title: Suspects identified in nightclub brawl involving group accompanying Yoshitha
byline: Police have identified the suspects linked to a violent altercation involving a group accompanying Yoshitha Rajapaksa outside a nightclub at Union Place, Colombo last night (22).

title: Sri Lanka and Thailand to hold 6th round of political consultations in Bangkok
byline: The 06th Round of Bilateral Political Consultations between Sri Lanka and Thailand will be held on 25 March 2025 at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Thailand in Bangkok.

title: Devinuwara double murder: 4 suspects ordered detained for questioning
byline: The Matara Magistrate’s Court has ordered that the four suspects arrested in connection with the Devinuwara shooting incident be detained for questioning until March 29, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: 50,000 killed in Gaza since start of Israel-Hamas war, health ministry says
byline: More than 50,000 Palestinians have been killed in Gaza since Israel’s war with Hamas began, the territory’s health ministry said Sunday, a grim milestone for a war with no end in sight as Israel resumes fighting and warns of even tougher days ahead.

title: Telugu star Vijay Deverakonda in Sri Lanka to shoot song sequence
byline: Telugu star Vijay Deverakonda, who was last seen in a cameo appearance in ‘Kalki 2898 AD’, has jetted off to Sri Lanka for the shoot of his new film ‘Kingdom’.

title: PM Harini calls for urgent action to tackle women’s challenges and discrimination
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has emphasized the urgent need for prompt and decisive measures to address the challenges, barriers, and discriminatory practices encountered by women both domestically and globally.

title: Pope Francis returns to Vatican after five weeks in hospital
byline: Pope Francis returned to the Vatican on Sunday after surviving a five-week battle in hospital against double pneumonia that became the most serious health crisis of his 12-year papacy.

title: MOE warns of fake notice on O/L science paper circulating on social media
byline: The Ministry of Education (MOE) states that a fake announcement misusing the names of the Ministry of Education and the Department of Examinations is presently circulating on social media.
